newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Polls open in Lithuanian parliamentary elections.
newsitem.headline: Polls open in Lithuanian parliamentary elections.

text.p: Lithuanians began voting on Sunday in parliamentary elections that a resurgent right-wing under independence hero Vytautas Landsbergis is expected to win.
Polling stations opened at seven a.m. (0400 GMT) and are due to close at 9 p.m. (1800 GMT) in the second parliamentary elections since the Baltic state quit the former Soviet Union in 1991.

Opinion polls suggest Landsbergis, who led the country's campaign for independence from the Soviet Union, is set to gain revenge on the ruling party of former Communists who ousted him in the 1992 elections.

The polls show his Homeland Union has a good chance of becoming the largest party in parliament but that it is likely to have to form a coalition to replace the governing Lithuanian Democratic Labour Party (LDLP).
